lines.text: [Vint bought a fishing rod instead of a bed that Naomi wanted]
Vinton Harper, I am not asking you, I am telling you. Now, take that silly thing back and bring me my bed.
You got no right to tell me what to do, that's Mama's job!
Grandma doesn't give me any rights!
You have the right to remain silent.

[after having been robbed by a burglar named The Courteous Crook]
He's been in there! He's actually been in my bathroom!
Did he take anything?
No, he cleaned up!
He even put on a new roll of toilet paper... and the right way too - from the bottom out!
I always thought it was supposed to roll over the top...
WHAT THE HELL DIFFERENCE DOES IT MAKE?
Good lord, Vinton, what in the hell do you think you're doing?
Well Mama... I'm trying to guess your weight...
I've got a better idea Vinton... how about you guess which hand I'm gonna smack you upside the head with.
[Vint pawned Mama's silver to bail his friend, Claude Cainmaker, whom Mama despises, out of jail]
Good Lord in heaven! You robbed me for that bum!
I didn't rob anybody! And he is not a bum. He is a man of vision and integrity and belief in his fellow human beings!
Well, what did he need that money for?
Bail!
[during loud arguments]
Well, I'll bet the neighbors are just lovin' this!
Thanks a lot, Mama!
[repeated line]
Knock, knock.
I tell ya, a guy selling brains could clean up in this family.
I wanna kill myself! Quick! Gimme somethin' Naomi made!
Here, Mama. Try one of these Spam and anchovy sandwiches.
Y'know, last night was the first night that Naomi and I didn't... didn't... well, you know, we didn't...
There goes the Guinness Book of Records.
Why doesn't anything good ever happen to me? All I do is cook and clean!
Well, hell, you can't even do that!
You're skatin' on thin ice old lady!

[to Vint's boss Mr. Carstairs]
I'm sure your wife will understand if you just explain it to her.
[Mrs. Carstairs blows the car horn outside]
Or maybe not.
Well, Buzz, I believe you've gotten taller behind my back.
Sorry.
Magic moments between a man and a woman are spiritual and ought not to be screwed with.
My dogs are barkin'.
The only way to keep from goin' crazy in this house is to stay half lit.
If you want your talent appreciated in this world, you gotta go to Broadway!
Aunt Fran, Mama has some good news and bad news. The bad news is... there isn't any good news.
Vinton, do you know what you get when you put your brain and my brain together? My brain.
Aren't you going to introduce your family?
Not if I can help it.
Oh, you just love to put people down, don't you, Mrs. Harper?
It is not only a pleasure, I see it as my duty!
Sonja, honey, did your mama ever talk to you about boys?
Well, she told me never to marry a locksmith.
For 50 years I have been in charge of Christmas. I've jingled your bells and I've roasted your chestnuts. This Christmas you goons can just rum-pa-pum-pum without me.
I'm glad I put the tinsel on strand-by-strand. It gives the tree such symmetry.
Yeah, and it balances it out, too.
I love a Boy's Choir at Christmas.
That's 'cause you've never had to sit through one.
Well what the hell are you waiting for? Open up the door and let the good times roll...
Vint, I don't ever lend money. Not ever. I just don't. Ever.
Getting the right message isn't easy, it could take all night.
The hell you say.
[presses record button]
It's your dime, spill it!
Grandma, you've got to admit it... There's nothing like the tree to get you into that Christmas spirit.
Yeah, sure, nothing gives me more comfort and joy than cleaning up pine needles for two weeks.
[repeated line]
Old lady, this time, you've gone too far!
Franny, don't drink if you can't hold your hooch!

[Repeated line]
What kind of a smut show is this?
Good Lord!
From now on if we have any backstabbing to do were going to do it the way we have always done it face to face.
From now on, I'm not gonna give my family anything but hell!
